column4: Hi. I'm have trubbel installing Ubuntu on my Mac but cant seem to find any documentation.
What type of Mac is it?
do i need to do something about the bios or something?
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBook would be the starting point for the community Macbook documentation
I love you.
It's of rather variable quality, but will hopefully be useful :)
My big problem is that my mac won't boot the CD.

There are Mac instructions for burning ISOs to CD at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BurningIsoHowto#Mac%20OS%20X . You might want to double-check you did it right. I haven't had a Mac in a while, but I believe you should be able to just hold down C at startup to boot from CD...
no, it wouldn't affect it
have you booted from CD before? the timing on when to press the button to tell it to boot from CD is rather precise
no the CD is booted. It just dosn't happen anything.
lol no problem.
the help is very apriciated.
using the steps in https://help.ubuntu.com/community/MacBook , can you find out your hardware revision for me, please?
but every guide assumes that the cd boots properly which it dosn't :P
indeed. It's just a completely black screen?
no its just a "-" sign blinking on a black screen. Looks like terminal. Allthough i can't type anything.
which version of Ubuntu is it?
the latest.
the latest released (9.10/karmic)?
really strange. No, I'm not good enough to try some beta-testing just yet :P
I think I'm out of ideas. You might want to stick around and see if anyone else can figure it out, and/or ask in the Mac-specific support forum at http://ubuntuforums.org/forumdisplay.php?f=328
there are some folks there who are much smarter than me about Mac stuff :)
Okay. Great thanks for your time!
